clues.text: They're the 2 precious metals in Montana's motto "Oro y plata"
Oregon's motto, "She flies with her own wings", refers to 1843 when it decided to break from both the U.S. & this nation
2 states have the words "liberty" & "independence" in their mottoes: Pennsylvania & this "First State"
The Kansas motto, "Ad astra per aspera", translates as "To" these "through difficulties"
Its motto, "Equal Rights", reflects the fact that its women were given the right to vote in 1869
Early images show this Roman god as a handsome man; by the mid-300s B.C. he was a chubby, naked infant toting a weapon
This round table knight was famed for his bravery & skill in battle, but keepin' his mitts off the boss' wife... fail
This monk: "If you want others to be happy, practice compassion, if you want to be happy, practice compassion"
The 1684 second part of this allegory features the compassionate Mr. Great-Heart
"History of My Life" by this 18th century Italian adventurer relates his (many) conquests as a lover
Criticism from a Filipino delegate prompted this Soviet premier to bare his sole to the General Assembly in 1960
In 2009, in his first speech to the U.N. after 40 years in power, this North African threatened to tear the U.N. Charter
In a 2008 U.N. speech, this Iranian called the U.S. a "bullying power"
At the U.N. podium where George W. Bush had spoken the day before, Hugo Chavez said, "It still smells of" this element
"President Reagan, Rambo only exists in movies", said Daniel Ortega, warning the U.S. against invading this country

Carmela Soprano &
Nurse Jackie Peyton

Bret Maverick &
Jim Rockford

Veronica Mars &
Jeannie Van Der Hooven

Michael Knight &
Mitch Buchannon

Illya Kuryakin &
Dr. Donald "Ducky" Mallard
Last name of Lucian, a certain psychoanalyst's grandson; his '50s paintings keyed on realistic nudes, for some reason
He's hosted the Tony Awards & in 2014 won one for "Hedwig and the Angry Inch"
For decades this alliterative anthropologist was a curator of ethnology at the American Museum of Natural History
Keep incredibly calm & carry on; Britannica says "tranquillity of mind" is key to this ancient Greek philosophy
1874's "The Moldau" by this composer depicts his beloved Czech landscape
Holy this city!  Located on both banks of the Maumee River, it's named for a city in Spain
Benjamin Harrison went to this university--in Oxford, Ohio, not Florida
Courtesy of Genoa, Italy, a 20-foot statue stands in in City Hall Plaza in this city
The first rubber company in Akron was founded by this man who was named for Benjamin Franklin
The 665-foot Great American Tower, this city's tallest building, stands at Queen City Square near Fourth & Sycamore Streets
For nearly a quarter century, this company used the advertising slogan "We bring good things to life"
A song from this musical begins, "To life, to life, L'chaim!"
He's the subject of the novel & movie "Lust for Life"
A popular phrase since World War I to lead a comfortable life is to "live the life of" him
The movie "Life of Pi" was based on a novel by this author
This No. 1 song was originally called "Kitty" but Toni Basil changed the title after coming up with the cheerleader theme
This song by Boston says, "I'm gonna take you by surprise and make you realize"
Chuck Berry's first Top 40 hit was this one about a girl in a Coupe de Ville
Rats!  Michael Jackson had a No. 1 hit in 1972 with this movie theme
Buddy Holly named this song for his drummer's girlfriend

rounds.comments: (Alex: The letter "K" will come up in the middle of each correct response--the exact center.)

clues.text: During Prohibition, it was a place where alcohol was illegally sold & consumed
As of May 4, 2003 this small metal item no longer admitted riders to the Manhattan subway
It can precede box, dive or scraper
With outerwear or without, it's a private lounge next to a legislative chamber
In the title of a 1967 work, Desmond Morris called humans this type of ape
Maryland & Mississippi both "got" this as their state drink or beverage
They're the 2 beverages that are combined to make an Arnold Palmer
Clam chowder made with tomatoes is commonly given the name of this island
This popular brand of soy & veggie burgers was named for a Florida city
At a luau, you might feast on this slow-roasted shredded pork dish whose name sounds like a coffee liqueur

1944:
Carleton Mabee, writing about this "American Leonardo", master of the dot & dash

1999:
A. Scott Berg, writing about this pilot;
1954:
the same pilot, writing about himself

1989:
Richard Ellmann, writing about this "earnest" Irish wit

1933:
Allan Nevins, writing about this pres. (hint: Nevins won in non-consecutive years, for 1937's "Hamilton Fish")

1964:
Walter Jackson Bate, writing about this "Endymion" poet
Alternative energy sources like solar & wind are also called this kind of energy because you can't use them up
BTU is the stock symbol of Peabody Energy, which mines for this black stuff
A 375-foot unit in this type of facility is the tallest structure in Port Arthur, Texas
The San Onofre one of these plants will cost over $4 billion & take decades--not to build but to decommission
This type of energy makes the Niagara plant New York State's biggest producer of electricity

rounds.text: At the end of this play: "Why are our bodies soft & weak... but that our... hearts should well agree with our external parts?"
